result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Stam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid in 60 days or penalty of 17 days jail for non-payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Restitution was paid in full prior to sentencing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J Stam

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon J Stam in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes sentencing recommendations. Attorney Menden makes sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statements. Court sentences the Defendant to the following.

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

RESTITUTION:  Already paid in full. 

FINE :  $631.00 + $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid within 60 days, 17 days jail alternate for non payment)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Brandon J Stam in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Menden states that the defendant was unable to pay restitution up front on today's date. Court resets sentencing hearing for Defendant to pay restitution.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brandon J Stam in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended criminal complaint.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended criminal complaint.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended criminal complaint.  Attorney Menden and the state request a sentencing date so restitution issues can be figured out.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Case not called on the record due to ongoing jury trial. Jury trial set for 07/19/16 is off. Case set for plea/sentencing hearing on 08/02/16.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brandon J Stam in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests a jury status and jury trial date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon J Stam in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment as she was just assigned to this case.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or with the Spur Saloon listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Brandon J Stam in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
